directives.title: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
directives.subtitle: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

directives.title: High DNS Bytes Out
directives.subtitle: High DNS queries bytes amount from host per short period of time

directives.title: High DNS Requests Rate
directives.subtitle: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

events.205: Suspicious Dynamic DNS Public IP Check
Suspicious Dynamic DNS Public IP Check

directives.title: Wannacry Killswitch Domain
directives.subtitle: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

directives.title: Telegram Bot API Request
directives.subtitle: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

directives.title: Network Scans
directives.subtitle: Detects many failed connection attempts to different ports or hosts

events.260: Unusual connection received on unusual port
Unusual connection received on unusual port

directives.title: Equation Group C2 Communication
directives.subtitle: Detects communication to C2 servers mentioned in the operational notes of the ShadowBroker leak of EquationGroup C2 tools

directives.title: Possible DNS Tunneling
directives.subtitle: Normally, DNS logs contain a limited amount of different dns queries for a single domain. This rule detects a high amount of queries for a single domain, which can be an indicator that DNS is used to transfer data.

directives.title: High NULL Records Requests Rate
directives.subtitle: Extremely high rate of NULL record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of iodine tool execution

directives.title: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
directives.subtitle: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer

directives.title: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
directives.subtitle: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

directives.title: High TXT Records Requests Rate
directives.subtitle: Extremely high rate of TXT record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of Do-exfiltration tool execution

events.205: Suspicious Dynamic DNS Public IP Check
Suspicious Dynamic DNS Public IP Check
Suspicious Dynamic DNS Public IP Check

directives.title: Executable from Webdav
directives.subtitle: Detects executable access via webdav6. Can be seen in APT 29 such as from the emulated APT 29 hackathon https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29/

directives.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions - Zeek
directives.subtitle: Detects known sensitive file extensions via Zeek

events.65: Download Of File With Malicious PowerShell
Download Of File With Malicious PowerShell

directives.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe - Zeek
directives.subtitle: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

events.161: Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create
Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create

directives.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe - Zeek
directives.subtitle: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

directives.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity - Zeek
directives.subtitle: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL. Based on the SIGMA rules/windows/builtin/win_impacket_secretdump.yml

directives.title: Publicly Accessible RDP Service
directives.subtitle: Detects connections from routable IPs to an RDP listener - which is indicative of a publicly-accessible RDP service.

directives.title: Kerberos Network Traffic RC4 Ticket Encryption
directives.subtitle: Detects kerberos TGS request using RC4 encryption which may be indicative of kerberoasting

directives.title: Potential Exfiltration of Compressed Files
directives.subtitle: This rule detects potential exfiltration by looking for a few compression extensions in the uri and signs of compression in the mime type, file type, and http body

events.75: FTP File Upload to a Public Server
events.206: Suspicious FTP Upload to an External Server

events.75: FTP File Upload to a Public Server
events.206: Suspicious FTP Upload to an External Server

directives.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Execution
directives.subtitle: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate an execution techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE

directives.title: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Persistence
directives.subtitle: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate a persistence techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE.

events.161: Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create
Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create

directives.title: WebDav Put Request
directives.subtitle: A General detection for WebDav user-agent being used to PUT files on a WebDav network share. This could be an indicator of exfiltration.

directives.title: Domain User Enumeration Network Recon 01
directives.subtitle: Domain user and group enumeration via network reconnaissance. Seen in APT 29 and other common tactics and actors. Detects a set of RPC (remote procedure calls) used to enumerate a domain controller. The rule was created based off the datasets and hackathon from https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29

directives.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
directives.subtitle: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

events.161: Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create
Potential Lateral Movement: Psexec SMB Create

directives.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
directives.subtitle: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

events.258: Unusual SMB2 Create for an .exe file
Unusual SMB2 Create for an .exe file

directives.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
directives.subtitle: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

events.75: FTP File Upload to a Public Server
events.206: Suspicious FTP Upload to an External Server

events.75: FTP File Upload to a Public Server
events.206: Suspicious FTP Upload to an External Server

directives.title: Brute Force
directives.subtitle: Detects many authentication failures from one source to one destination which is may indicate Brute Force activity
